trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when an error is made adding a <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> to a <xref href="System.Net.CookieContainer"></xref>.

This exception is thrown if an attempt is made to <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.Add%2A> a <xref:System.Net.Cookie> with length greater than <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.MaxCookieSize%2A> to a <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer>.
**Associated Tips**
**Make sure the cookie size does not exceed the maximum allowed by the cookie container.**
This exception is thrown when an attempt is made to add a <xref:System.Net.Cookie> with length greater than <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer.MaxCookieSize%2A> to a <xref:System.Net.CookieContainer>.
The default maximum cookie size is 4096 bytes.
**When setting the Name property for a cookie, make sure the value is not a null reference or empty string.**
The <xref:System.Net.Cookie.Name%2A> property must be initialized before using an instance of the <xref:System.Net.Cookie> class.
The following characters are reserved and cannot be used for this attribute value: equal sign, semicolon, comma, new line (\n), carriage return (\r), tab (\t).
The dollar sign ($) character cannot be the first character.
**When setting the Port property for a cookie, make sure the value is valid and enclosed in double quotes.**
The <xref:System.Net.Cookie.Port%2A> attribute restricts the ports to which a cookie may be sent.
The default value means no restriction.
Setting the property to an empty string ("") restricts the port to the one used in the HTTP response.
Otherwise the value must be a string in quotation marks that contains port values delineated with commas.
**When setting the Value property for a cookie, make sure the value is not null.**
The following characters are reserved and cannot be used for this property: semicolon, comma.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.CookieException"></xref> class.
The default constructor for <xref:System.Net.CookieException>.
Initializes a new instance of the class with specific values of serializationInfo and streamingContext.
Allows you to set up custom serialization.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to be used.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> to be used.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> instance with the data needed to serialize the <xref href="System.Net.CookieException"></xref>.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
For more information, see [XML and SOAP Serialization](~/docs/framework/serialization/xml-and-soap-serialization.md).
Any objects included in the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> are automatically tracked and serialized by the formatter.
The object that holds the serialized object data.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that specifies the destination for this serialization.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> instance with the data needed to serialize the <xref href="System.Net.CookieException"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to be used.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> to be used.
